result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John P Bell was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & Is eligible for Substance Abuse programs    Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises  Operate only MV with a IID installed  Agent needs to agree that the deft can apply for a drivers license.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Enter, participate in, and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent, may not withdraw from any treatment program involved in unless given the express permission of the agent and treatment provider.  Take medications as prescribed by treating physician.  Cooperate with and complete AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment. No alcohol/illegal substances or drug paraphernalia. Obtain/maintain employment.  Submit to a DNA sample unless previously provided.  Pay costs and supervision fees as directed by the agent.  No firearms-weapons.

Defendant John P Bell in court, in custody with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  No factual errors were found in the PSI report.  Court has some questions of the probation agent appearing by phone.  Probation will make the necessary corrections and upload a new document for the court.  Statements made by Defense (State to remain silent)

Court orders:
1 yr  Initial conf 3 yr Extended Conf consecutive to current prison sentence from Lincoln County case 05CF27
Conditions of extended super as stated on page 20 plus   Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises
Operate only MV with a IID installed.  Agent needs to agree that the deft can apply for a DL.
$600 fine + Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.
AODA assessment and treatment w/any followup that is necessary
DL revoked 3 years
Pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court orders that for a period of __36 months, beginning on _7/28/15, each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Also, pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court further orders that for a period of _36__ months, beginning on the date the Department of Transportation issues any license to the defendant granted under Ch. 343, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the defendant's operating privileges for the operation of Class D vehicles be restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device.
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & Is eligible for Substance Abuse programs

0 days sentence credit for this case.  Should be getting credit for the 178 days on his revocation case.
